title: The nature of Irelia gives her kill pressure even when behind
body:
No, this isn't a "RIOT NERF IRELIA PLS" salt post. In fact, my gripe with Irelia isn't as large as the other champs I detest. A good majority of the time I don't lose lane vs her (Although my LAST GAME against her I did lose lane because she kept being greedy and getting me low, but I won in K/DA. However, this forced me to back frequently so she got my turret relatively quickly), but I've noticed even when I get massive leads against her, she still doesn't fail to pull some flashy bs and kill my entire backline in a teamfight. This gives me the conclusion of her ability to be hypermobile at any stage of the game gives her a large amount of kill pressure, and it's kind of amazing how she can reset her dash three times on the same target at rapid speeds. 

What I think Riot should do is cool it with her mobility (No, don't GUT her. That would just remove her identity.)

That is what people said about Akali W being OP and her heal being annoying. Her identity is removed, it is better to keep her mobility as it is now without any changes.

That rework is a different issue all in itself. My issue with the Akali rework was the fact they took her old kit, which was overall unhealthy and kind of dumb, and morphed it to be 'different' but still remain the same concept but even better. 

Her Old passive gave her ridiculous lane sustainability as an Assassin. Yes, her new passive doesn't do this anymore but rather gives her an empowered attack. But her Q is the ability that gives her the lane sustainability now. Not to mention her q was annoying poke, and still is, annoying poke (Thankfully, not point and click)

Her shroud rework was an overall buff for the previous shroud. She still had the concept of peaking in and out of it and repeatedly sneaking in and poking and taking out carries. 

Here en lies the issue; No one liked Akali's ability to do this to begin with. And the fact they practically made her shroud even BETTER than before. She could even harass you under turret. 

Now her ult; it's pretty much the same as before, but instead of holding two charges, it's just two dashes with a micro stun. However, people HATED this ability. And the fact they gave it EXECUTION damage is what angered people the most. 

Akali's rework was less of a redesign and more of "How can we take this kit and make it modernized for today's standards."

A rework is supposed to redesign a champion's kit and keep their playstyle and identity, not keep the same problems from before and buff them.
That's why she has been absolutely gutted. Granted, her previous problems are gone forever, but now we have a mess of a character that hardly works without those problems.


But this post is about Irelia, not poor Akali

I'll make it easy to understand why her design is fundamentally broken for an **assassin**. Also her kit is completely different, nothing is the same. I have played 1.5k games on Akali before the rework so I can say that this kit is **completely different without any similarities** (even her W is different than her old W)

**Passive is counter intuitive for an assassin** as it back loads all the burst on a circle that is difficult to use in team fights. As an example, It is similar in concept of Fiora passive. it gives MS and does damage if proc'd, but without heal.

Heal was her identity and should be kept no matter what people say. Her heal and triple dash were her identity and by triple dash I mean: Triple dash, charge system and point and click. Those two were the **core** of Akali not her damn shitty ass broken ass Shroud.

Her old kit isn't peaking out and in unless your behind. Her kit was all about burst the fuck out of them and either Zhonyas to wait rotation or dodge/run away. 

I agree with you on this. Practically all Akali mains hate that they removed her old ultimate and put a stun and an executon which is bull shit to play as and to play against, because you removed her most core identity of Akali and you have introduced something that a lot of people will hate and is actually a toxic mechanic to add, just make her passive instantaneous with no circle and bring back triple dash.

It wasn't modernized or redisgned, her kit was removed and replaced with a completely new one. Nunu kept things and his other things either been removed or updated to modern standard. That rework is a modernization rework. Irelia rework was fantastic, the problem is that she was strong as shit, but Irelia mains seem to be happy with her now.

The thing about Irelia is that, if you touch her mobility **at all**, she becomes a worthless champion. Let me explain why.

Irelia is a teamfight skirmisher which means she can basically 1v1 any other non skirmisher/hybrid skirmisher in the game except true duelists like Riven, Tryndamere, Jax and Fiora. This is why split pushing on her isn't very ideal at least in today's meta where these skirmishers run rampant so you are left with one other option and that is to teamfight (which is what her kit revolves around). If you touch her mobility (which is why shes a nuisance in teamfights) she effectively becomes useless. She's already had her teamfight nerfed by getting rid of the magic reduction on her W completely, anything further is just digging a deeper grave.

I absolutely hated new irelia for a long time, but I have to actually agree with this, it's pretty accurate
People downvoting me into oblivion because they cant handle the facts lmao.

I perma banned irelia until last patch bc I just could not ever deal with her stupid amounts of mobility and utility. Then i found out how hard poppy stomps her into the ground and i don't ban her anymore

Thing about high dmg champions and squishy champions... 

When a champion that builds/has any sort of tankiness destroys a dmg dealer in lane and builds vs them accordingly the damage dealer will struggle in two ways... they will be behind and their opponent will extend this lead with a build that effectively puts them even more behind. So they don't only just have less dmg then they would otherwise but that less damage is less effective against their opponent. 

A squishy however stays squishy and so a champion that is innately damage focused it only going to be minorly set back vs that opponent. 

EX. A high dmg champion with two items deals 1500 damage in a short period of time, however they are behind and deal physical dmg facing an opponent that ahead with 2000 hp and 150 armor that after mitigation can exceed the rate of damage they take with their own. HOWEVER! The squishy may only have 1200 hp or so by this point, so they are still very susceptible. Its takes a lot more of a difference in relative levels and items for a squishy to survive dmg cause they don't do nearly as much  to deal with it. 
When we are talking champions like irelia they have better base stats, better early game scaling, mobility and built in dmg reduction that if they play it right they effectively have a leg up back line champions on top of the fore mentioned, meaning need to be extremely behind to not be a significant threat to something that can die getting sneezed on.


The advantage these ranged squishies have is they can scale to a point they kill everything else before they can even engage, irelia is one case where and initial cc is optimal cause her engage is fast and strong.

Honestly I never liked how strong Irelia’s waveclear was with her Q last hit ability, as it felt impossible to actually shut her down and she always seemed to have a good early (but I’m not an expert on Irelia so her early might have really been bad).

Serious time, Most champions can come back when behind but some kits make it easier
Look at Irelia's kit, Damage reduction, a slow, a stun, magic damage passive, and high mobility, She also takes tiamat
If you're bad at her, You won't be getting back on the board unless you steal kills in team fights
If you're good at her, You can use all that to catch up just because that's how her kit is, It has good outplay potential and while not inherently hard, You'll still see a big difference between a bad Irelia and a good Irelia

She allows good players to get back on the board if they play right
And bad players to feed even more unless they get lucky

The general kill pressure however is just naturally in her kit
Everything I listed before, A slow, a stun, high mobility, and her passive give her good kill pressure
Normally mobile champs have high kill pressure because they can easily jump on her, But add passive damage on, tiamat, and two forms of CC and her kill pressure becomes a little crazy
The point is even with all that, a bad Irelia won't make much use of it assuming their opponent knows what they're doing against her

I like that about Irelia though, very few Champs can pull it off.

People compare her to Jax a lot, but this is one way she's very different from Jax. Jax demands consists  and his power curve is very linear. Irelia may be ahead or behind but regardless her power jumps suddenly in the midgame.

It kind of fits her thematically too.
